docs.lead_paragraph: Oral doses of laetrile produce higher levels of cyanide in the bloodstream, but the controversial drug produces no serious short-term toxic effects, doctors at the Mayo Clinic reported yesterday.

headline.main: Laetrile Study Finds Cyanide Up, But Toxic Effects Are Minimized

docs.snippet: Oral doses of laetrile produce higher levels of cyanide in the bloodstream, but the controversial drug produces no serious short-term toxic effects, doctors at the Mayo Clinic reported yesterday.
